title: 112_hr3484
content: The "Travel Regional Investment Partnership Act" emphasizes the importance of travel and tourism, highlighting its significant impact on the economy. It acknowledges the employment opportunities and economic contributions of the industry while recognizing the need for public-private partnerships to promote domestic tourism growth. The Secretary will establish a grant program through the Office of Travel and Tourism Industries to boost domestic regional tourism and create new markets. Grants will range from $100,000 to $1,000,000 and can be awarded to State tourism offices, local destination marketing organizations, and partnerships between governments and tourism entities. Priority may be given to regions with low tourism marketing contributions, maintaining regional diversity, and benefiting rural destinations. The grant program aims to boost domestic regional tourism and create new markets. Grants can be used for promoting tourism growth and creating new markets. Eligible entities must submit an application with details of tourist promotion activities. The partnership between a State or local government and local tourism entities must include specific tourist entities, partnership details, explanation of how it will increase regional tourism, and the anticipated impact on job creation. Non-federal funds are required for grant recipients. Non-federal matching funds are required for grant recipients, with a limit of 25% for in-kind contributions. The Secretary must report on travel-generated expenditures, tax receipts, and employment annually. Definitions include "local tourist entity" and "Secretary." Authorization of $10,000,000 for tourism grants under the Secretary of Commerce for the first 5 fiscal years after enactment.
